str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
All, the whole, altogether. Absolutely all or every one.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Apparently a primary word; a people.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To stone down, stone to death, overwhelm with stones. From kata and lithazo; to stone down, i.e. To death.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A primary verb; to convince; by analogy, to pacify or conciliate; reflexively or passively, to assent, to rely.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.
